reviews.text: This is a large, modern, full-service hotel. The rooms and bathroom and spacious, with spotless housekeeping. Many in-house amenities include indoor and outdoor pools; workout room; etc. Nice breakfast on the club level. Great view of the Red Sea from many of the rooms -- ask for one since it is better than the city view.
reviews.title: Full service hotel with a view

likes.liked: — It was comfortable and close to my business needs
likes.disliked: — It is in Saudi Arabia -- the hotel is an island in a very restrictive culture

reviews.title: Luxury of the highest order
reviews.text: There are a variety of restaurants, including an "American Diner" if you need a burger (as another reviewer notes, some of the decor starts to look like Disney concept restaurants.) The food of various cuisines in the other restaurants is quite good, so it would be a shame to default to a burger.

The service was farily good throughout, and made a nice respite when something would make you a little nuts about being in Saudi Arabia (Try changing a flight booking with Saudi Air. It's like dealing with the DMV from hell, except that I was rescued when I cut past the confusion in the ticketing office and just walked up to someone whose desk who seemed to be on the sidelines, not doing much. He was very helpful in untangling the maze of odd rebooking requirements and getting a boarding pass days before the flight!)
reviews.title: Nice building but service lacking

reviews.text: Face it: few come to Jeddah unless they are on business, but this hotel will make you very comfortable.
reviews.title: Fantastic building, but beginning to tire....

reviews.text: If you are doing business in Saudi Arabia, the Jeddah Hilton provides a respite from the disadvantages of the surroundings. The rooms are comfortable and well maintained, and are also a decent size. The lobby is quite impressive and the hotel has a luxurious look.
reviews.title: A NIce Hotel if You Have to be in Jeddah

likes.disliked: — The sight of the Saudi army guns at the hotel entrance

reviews.text: Most of the restaurants are somewhat disappointing, so I found myself ordering from room service fairly often, just so I could choose the best from each. The main restaurant serves only buffet style, except for some limited hours in the afternoon, so I rarely ate there, except for breakfast. There is another restaurant that tries to emulate an American '50s diner, but it fails miserably. I remember those diners, and they never served a hamburger with a hole in the middle, as they do in this restaurant. The Persian restaurant provides great food and attentive service.
reviews.title: Great gym but otherwise average

reviews.text: I didn't know how lucky I was to stay at the Hilton in Jeddah, until we were required to leave for three days to make way for participants of the recent oil summit. We got very little notice from the hotel, but they were subject to a royal decree that they could not ignore. The Hilton management did all they could to arrange rooms for us at an alternative hotel, which didn't come close to the comfort of the Hilton. But, that's another review altogether. Needless to say, I was glad to get back to the Hilton after three days in a relative dump.
reviews.title: big and dated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hilton is pretty far from the central business district of Jeddah, but that isn't really a bad thing. The Jeddah Hilton is a good choice, especially considering the alternatives.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

likes.disliked: — service in restaurant was slightly slow

reviews.text: This Hilton hotel is located on the Red Sea quite a distance from Jeddah. It is a very large hotel with a huge atrium lobby . Nice features of this hotel are the leisure facilitles - great gym pool and even a bowling alley.
reviews.title: disappointing hilton

reviews.text: Checked into the hotel for two nights on May 18th, 2007. It is a magnificent property. All staff from front desk to housekeeping to restaurant are a delight. The rooms are in immaculate condition. There were some discrepancies with the telephone calls made and they were immidiately resolved without any questions at check-out.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

likes.disliked: — A bit out of downtown and lack of available transports

reviews.text: I would definitely recomend all to stay at this property. Only downside was that taxis were a little hard to find and the hotel was about a 30 minute drive from downton.
reviews.title: If you are in Jeddah, don't think of anything but the Hilton

reviews.text: Not that this is tourist destination #1 in anyone's books but if you do happen to have to be in Jeddah, do not think of staying anywhere but the Hilton.
reviews.title: Nice Building and No Problems

reviews.text: The property itself is magnificent, very opulently done up but not distastefully, the Hilton has 11 floors of very well appointed rooms which are huge by Western standards.
reviews.title: Very poor service!

likes.liked: — Large hotel, has lots of facilities

reviews.title: brilliant view, excellent facilities, okay service
reviews.text: Ask for a sea-view room when checking in, you'll be pleasantly surprised by the views of the Red Sea (every room has a balcony). There are 5 specialty restaurants on the property and save for the omission of pork or alcohol on the menu, they cater to every palette. The room service menu is plentiful and they are very quick to deliver.
